intro: Espeletia griffinii, commonly known as the Griffin's espeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean highlands of Colombia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-like growth habit and dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flower heads that bloom in late summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
